means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 丘住所名称，来源于不列颠河流名，含义是“幼兽，雏鸟”(young animal or bird)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 丘住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“鱼鳃”(fish gill)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 丘饶舌者或爱偷窃者，来源于古英语，含义是“红嘴乌鸦”(chough)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"咬，啃"之意。
means: bite ： 指用牙齿钳住或切断，或咬一口。
gnaw ： 指连续不断用齿咬。

sentence.Network_en: He tends to chew things over too much in his mind.
sentence.Network_cn: 他这个人就爱在心里反复琢磨事儿。

sentence.Network_en: Chew your food well and do not rush meals.
sentence.Network_cn: 充分咀嚼食物，吃饭不要太快。

sentence.Network_en: Savour the flavour of each mouthful, and chew your food well.
sentence.Network_cn: 细细品尝每一口的味道，充分咀嚼。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)chat in a leisurely way， especially at length

lj.lj_ly: he chewed me out for being late.
lj.lj_ls: 他因为我迟到而训了我。

jx.jx_en_mean: discuss or consider something at length
jx.jx_cn_mean: 详细讨论（某事）；对（某事）深思熟虑

lj.lj_ly: executives met to chew over the company's future.
lj.lj_ls: 主管人员会面详细讨论公司的未来。

jx.jx_en_mean: chew food until it is soft or in small pieces
To talk together in a friendly, leisurely way; chat at length.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 聊天：友好轻松地一起交谈；很长时间地聊天

phrase.cizu_name: chew the fat 或 chew the rag &I{【俚语】}

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cēowan, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch kauwen and German kauen

entry.def: When you chew food, you use your teeth to break it up in your mouth so that it becomes easier to swallow.

example.ex: Be certain to eat slowly and chew your food extremely well...
example.tran: 一定要慢慢吃，要细细咀嚼。

example.ex: Daniel leaned back on the sofa, still chewing on his apple.
example.tran: 丹尼尔倚在沙发上，嘴里还在嚼着苹果。

entry.def: If you chew gum or tobacco, you keep biting it and moving it around your mouth to taste the flavour of it. You do not swallow it.
If you chew your lips or your fingernails, you keep biting them because you are nervous.

example.ex: He chewed his lower lip nervously.

entry.def: If a person or animal chews an object, they bite it with their teeth.

example.ex: They pause and chew their pencils...
example.tran: 他们停了下来，咬着铅笔。

example.ex: One owner left his pet under the stairs where the animal chewed through electric cables.
example.tran: 有个人把宠物放在楼梯下面，结果它在那儿把电线咬断了。

entry.def: A chew is a sweet that you have to chew very hard before it becomes soft.

example.tran: 各式各样可供选择的便宜口嚼糖

entry.tran: 试图承担力不能及的事
entry.def: If you say that someone has bitten off more than they can chew, you mean that they are trying to do something which is too difficult for them.

example.ex: Micky is used to handling dodgy deals but this time fears he may have bitten off more than he can chew.
example.tran: 米基本来是善于处理棘手交易的，可是这回他可能会力有不逮。

entry.def: If people chew the fat, they talk in a relaxed, informal way.

example.ex: We'd been lounging around, chewing the fat for a couple of hours.
example.tran: 我们东游西逛，瞎扯了两三个钟头。

means.word_mean: 1. a wad of something chewable as tobacco
2. biting and grinding food in your mouth so it becomes soft enough to swallow

sentences.sentence: "Chew your food and don't swallow it!"

auth_sentence.content: You are biting off more than you can chew.
auth_sentence.res_content: You are biting off more than you can chew.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You are biting off more than you can chew.

auth_sentence.content: We plant expensive trees, they chew them down.
auth_sentence.res_content: We plant expensive trees, they chew them down.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We plant expensive trees, they chew them down.

auth_sentence.content: Chew Magna, Somerset Why is it so great?
auth_sentence.res_content: Chew Magna, Somerset Why is it so great?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chew Magna, Somerset Why is it so great?

Sentence.sentence: Her listeners were showing their respect for her by chewing on her words.
Her listeners were showing their respect for her by chewing on her words.

sentences.en: Don't bite off more than you can chew.

jushi.english: His broken jaw made it impossible for him to chew.
jushi.chinese: 他的颌裂了,不能嚼东西了。

jushi.english: Don't bite off more than you can chew.
The mother told her child to chew food.
jushi.chinese: 这位母亲告诉她的孩子要细嚼食物。
